penguin.fds – Special File Descriptors¶

penguin.fds.eventfd()¶

create a file descriptor for event notification

see man 2 eventfd for more complete documentation

Parameters:
  • initval (non-negative int) – where to initialize the new eventfd’s counter (default 0)
  • flags (int) –

    flags to apply for the new file descriptor (default 0)

    this argument won’t be available on kernels without eventfd2(2)
Returns:

integer, a new eventfd file descriptor
penguin.fds.read_eventfd()¶

read the counter out of an eventfd-created file descriptor

utility method, equivalent to struct.unpack(‘Q’, os.read(fd, 8))

Parameters:fd (int) – the file descriptor from which to read an event
Returns:integer, the value read from the eventfd descriptor
penguin.fds.read_signalfd()¶

read signal info from a file descriptor created with signalfd

Parameters:fd (int) – file descriptor to read a signal from
Returns:a two-tuple representing the signal it received, (signum, reason_code)
penguin.fds.signalfd()¶

create a file descriptor that can be used to accept signals

Parameters:
  • fd (int) – signalfd descriptor to modify, or -1 to create a new one
  • signals (iterable of ints) – signals to receive on the signalfd
  • flags (int) – flags to apply to the signalfd
Returns:

integer, a new signalfd descriptor
penguin.fds.timerfd_create()¶

create a new timer and return a file descriptor that refers to it

Parameters:
  • clockid (int) – the type of clock to use (default CLOCK_REALTIME)
  • flags (int) – flags to set on the new fd (default 0)
Returns:

integer, a new timerfd descriptor
penguin.fds.timerfd_gettime()¶

return the setting of the timer referred to by a file descriptor

Parameters:fd (int) – file descriptor to read the timer from
Returns:a two-tuple with the timer stored in the fd (time remaining until the trigger, interval after that)
penguin.fds.timerfd_settime()¶

arm or disarm the timer referred to by a timerfd file descriptor

Parameters:
  • fd (int) – the file descriptor to set a timer on
  • timeout (number) – time in seconds until the timer first triggers
  • interval (number) – interval in seconds at which to re-trigger the fd after the first fire (default of 0 means only trigger once)
  • absolute (int) – if True, sets the timer as absolute time (default False)
Returns:

a two-tuple with the timer that was previously stored in this fd (time remaining until the next trigger, interval after that)
penguin.fds.write_eventfd()¶

add a value into an eventfd-created file descriptor

utility method, equivalent to os.write(fd, struct.pack(‘Q’, value))

see man eventfd for exactly what this does

Parameters:
  • fd (int) – the file descriptor to be written to
  • value (non-negative int) – a value to add to the eventfd’s counter
